data.title: Chevy Chase
data.meta_description: Actors Cornelius Crane "Chevy" Chase (born October 8, 1943) is an American comedian, actor, writer, and producer. data.text:
Actors

Cornelius Crane “Chevy” Chase (born October 8, 1943) is an American comedian, actor, writer, and producer. Born into a prominent family, he had a variety of jobs before moving into comedy and started acting with National Lampoon. He became a key cast member in the first season of Saturday Night Live (which included Dan Aykroyd, John Belushi, Jane Curtin, Garrett Morris, Lorraine Newman, and Gilda Radner), where his recurring Weekend Update segment became a staple of the show. As both a performer and writer, he earned three Primetime Emmy Awards out of five nominations.

Chase had his first leading film role in Colin Higgins’s Foul Play (1978), with Goldie Hawn, Dudley Moore, Burgess Meredith, Eugene Roche, Rachel Roberts, Brian Dennehy and Billy Barty; earning two Golden Globe Award nominations. He is further known for his portrayals of Ty Webb in Harold Ramis‘s Caddyshack (1980), with Ted Knight, Rodney Dangerfield, and Bill Murray; Clark W. Griswold Jr. in five National Lampoon’s Vacation films (all with Beverly D’Angelo) and Irwin “Fletch” Fletcher in Fletch (1985), with Tim Matheson, Dana Wheeler-Nicholson, Geena Davis and Joe Don Baker; and its sequel Fletch Lives (1989), with with Hal Holbrook, Julianne Phillips, R. Lee Ermey, Richard Libertini, & Cleavon Little

Other prominent titles include Seems Like Old Times (1980), with Hawn and Charles Grodin; John Landis‘s Spies Like Us (1985), with Aykroyd; Three Amigos (1986), with Steve Martin and Martin Short; George Roy Hill‘s Funny Farm (1988), with Madelyn Smith; Nothing But Trouble (1991), with Aykroyd (who also directed), Demi Moore, and John Candy; Michael Ritchie’s Cops & Robbersons (1994), with Jack Palance, Dianne Wiest, and Robert Davi; Jake Kasdan’s Orange County (2002), with Colin Hanks, Jack Black, Catherine O’Hara, and John Lithgow; Stay Cool (2009), with Winona Ryder, Mark Polish, Hilary Duff, Sean Astin, Josh Holloway, and Jon Cryer; Steve Pink’s Hot Tub Time Machine (2010), with John Cusack, Rob Corddry, Craig Robinson, Clark Duke, Crispin Glover, and Lizzy Caplan; and Adam Rifkin’s The Last Movie Star (2017), with Burt Reynolds.

He has hosted the Academy Awards twice (1987 and 1988) and briefly had his own late-night talk show, The Chevy Chase Show (1993). He played the character Pierce Hawthorne on the NBC comedy series Community (with Joel McHale, Gillian Jacobs, Danny Pudi, Yvette Nicole Brown, Alison Brie, Donald Glover, Ken Jeong, and Jim Rash) from 2009 to 2014.

Each review will be linked to the title below.

(*seen originally in theaters)

(**seen rereleased in theaters)
